content:
Topic: ChatGPT Professional Proficiency: From Basics to Advanced Features
Target Audience: Professionals in different fields seeking deep proficiency without coding. They want to go from basics in LLMs such as prompt and context to medium-level features. They want to explore a large set of tools currently offered by ChatGPT. 
Duration: 24 hours

**Step number:** 6 out of 6.
 
**Sub-task:** Publish the final title and five-sentence description plus deliverables and progression
 
**Agent in charge of sub-task:** `idea_maker`
 
**Instructions:**
 
- Provide a final title that clearly signals format and depth (e.g., “24-hour Intensive — Medium-level Technical Course (No-Code)”).
- Write a five-sentence course description highlighting concrete tools (ADA, Browse, Vision, Image gen, file upload, Memory/Custom Instructions, Custom GPTs with Knowledge/Actions [no-code], GPT Store, Teams/Enterprise features), frameworks, hands-on labs, assessments, and outcomes.
- Add a bulleted list of four concrete learner deliverables (e.g., prompt library, Custom GPT scaffold with Knowledge file, ADA report, governance checklist and SOP).
- Include a 30-second marketing blurb and recommended next steps: two follow-up modules with duration and learning outcomes.
- Confirm final artifacts are saved to shared templates (syllabus.csv, rubric.csv, changelog.md) with agreed naming conventions.
 
**Status:** in progress ⏳

name: _Group_Tool_Executor

content:
**Ideas:**
   - Idea 1: Document Intelligence & Automation with ChatGPT — 24-hour Intensive (No-Code)
         * Description (five sentences): This 24-hour intensive no-code course takes professionals from prompt and context fundamentals to medium-level, enterprise-ready document pipelines. You will master ChatGPT tools including Advanced Data Analysis (ADA), Browse, Vision for PDFs/tables/images, image generation, file uploads/multi-file analysis, Memory/Custom Instructions, and Custom GPTs with Knowledge and no-code Actions, plus GPT Store and Teams/Enterprise features. Using proven frameworks (RTCFCE, ReAct, checklist prompts, A/B prompt versioning), you’ll run hands-on labs for dirty-scan OCR/extraction, normalization/QA, redlining, knowledge-backed Q&A, and governance. Assessment checkpoints and a capstone decision memo with SOP and governance checklist ensure measurable competency, grounded citations, and reproducible workflows. By the end, you will deliver a validated doc-to-decision workflow that is accurate, auditable, and ready for team deployment without writing code.
         * Learner deliverables (4):
           - Prompt library: 10 RTCFCE prompts with A/B scores and selection rationale.
           - Document extraction and QA pack: extracted CSV(s) from Vision/OCR dirty docs + error log + 5-point QA checklist.
           - ADA normalization report: normalized.csv + anomaly report + change_log.csv demonstrating reproducibility.
           - Custom GPT scaffold with Knowledge files and retrieval test_log.csv, plus a governance SOP and privacy checklist for your workflow.
         * 30-second marketing blurb: Turn messy PDFs and scans into decisions you can defend. In this hands-on, no-code intensive, you’ll practice Vision/OCR for real-world documents, validate results in ADA, and stand up a Knowledge-backed Q&A assistant—wrapped in governance that your enterprise can approve. We give you practical frameworks, checklists, and rubrics so your outputs are accurate, cited, and repeatable. Walk out with a capstone pipeline, SOP, and ready-to-share artifacts for your team.
         * Recommended next steps:
           - Follow-up module 1 (2 hours): Advanced Knowledge Retrieval QA — Learning outcomes: configure multi-file Knowledge sets and achieve ≥95% grounded answers with correct abstention; build a 10-question retrieval QA suite with pass/fail criteria.
           - Follow-up module 2 (3 hours): No-Code Actions via Structured Outputs — Learning outcomes: design stable JSON schemas for handoffs, validate schema conformance, and document a mock “consumer” SOP for downstream tools.
         * Final artifacts saved (shared templates and naming conventions): idea03_syllabus.csv (rebalance applied: M2=4:00, M7=3:30, M1=2:30, M4=2:30), rubric.csv (final practical and capstone rubrics with pass thresholds), idea03_changelog.md (annotated with selection rationale, rebalancing, and governance audit).
name: idea_maker

content:
**Ideas**

- Idea 1:
	* Idea 1: Document Intelligence & Automation with ChatGPT — 24-hour Intensive (No-Code)
		- Description (five sentences): This 24-hour intensive no-code course takes professionals from prompt and context fundamentals to medium-level, enterprise-ready document pipelines. You will master ChatGPT tools including Advanced Data Analysis (ADA), Browse, Vision for PDFs/tables/images, image generation, file uploads/multi-file analysis, Memory/Custom Instructions, and Custom GPTs with Knowledge and no-code Actions, plus GPT Store and Teams/Enterprise features. Using proven frameworks (RTCFCE, ReAct, checklist prompts, A/B prompt versioning), you’ll run hands-on labs for dirty-scan OCR/extraction, normalization/QA, redlining, knowledge-backed Q&A, and governance. Assessment checkpoints and a capstone decision memo with SOP and governance checklist ensure measurable competency, grounded citations, and reproducible workflows. By the end, you will deliver a validated doc-to-decision workflow that is accurate, auditable, and ready for team deployment without writing code.
		- Learner deliverables (4):
		- - Prompt library: 10 RTCFCE prompts with A/B scores and selection rationale.
		- - Document extraction and QA pack: extracted CSV(s) from Vision/OCR dirty docs + error log + 5-point QA checklist.
		- - ADA normalization report: normalized.csv + anomaly report + change_log.csv demonstrating reproducibility.
		- - Custom GPT scaffold with Knowledge files and retrieval test_log.csv, plus a governance SOP and privacy checklist for your workflow.
		- 30-second marketing blurb: Turn messy PDFs and scans into decisions you can defend. In this hands-on, no-code intensive, you’ll practice Vision/OCR for real-world documents, validate results in ADA, and stand up a Knowledge-backed Q&A assistant—wrapped in governance that your enterprise can approve. We give you practical frameworks, checklists, and rubrics so your outputs are accurate, cited, and repeatable. Walk out with a capstone pipeline, SOP, and ready-to-share artifacts for your team.
		- Recommended next steps:
		- - Follow-up module 1 (2 hours): Advanced Knowledge Retrieval QA — Learning outcomes: configure multi-file Knowledge sets and achieve ≥95% grounded answers with correct abstention; build a 10-question retrieval QA suite with pass/fail criteria.
		- - Follow-up module 2 (3 hours): No-Code Actions via Structured Outputs — Learning outcomes: design stable JSON schemas for handoffs, validate schema conformance, and document a mock “consumer” SOP for downstream tools.
		- Final artifacts saved (shared templates and naming conventions): idea03_syllabus.csv (rebalance applied: M2=4:00, M7=3:30, M1=2:30, M4=2:30), rubric.csv (final practical and capstone rubrics with pass thresholds), idea03_changelog.md (annotated with selection rationale, rebalancing, and governance audit).
